それじゃあ、よろしくね！\n%usernameusernameuserna%、頼:
Well then, I'm counting on you!
I'm counting on you, %usernameusernameuserna%!
体育祭なんだから、体操服になるに決まってるでしょ？: It's a sports festival, so of course you'll be wearing gym clothes, right?
……いや、普段の服は実戦でも使えるものだろ？\n別に着替える必要はないんじゃない:
...No, normal clothes can be used in real combat too, right?
You don't really need to change, do you?
それとこれとは別でしょう？\nお祭りなんだから、衣装はちゃんと着替えないと。:
That's different, isn't it?
It's a festival, so you have to change your clothes properly.
……そういうものなのか？ いやまあ、\n郷に入っては郷に従えっていうからな……:
...Is that how it works? No, well,
After all, when you enter a village, you have to obey it...
ねえねえ、それよりも早く特訓しようよ！\nもう待ちきれなくて、うずうずしちゃって:
Hey, hey, let's do some special training already!
I can't wait any longer, and I'm itching to go!
ああ、分かった分かった……ごほん。貴様ら！\nこれから体育祭に優勝するために俺が:
Ah, I get it, I understand... Ahem. You bastards!
I'm going to become an instructor so I can win the sports festival!
お前らの返事は全部『イエッサー』とする！\n教官である俺の指示に従うように！ 分:
All of your replies will be yessir!
Follow my instructions as an instructor! Understood!
いい返事だ！ それでは早速始めるぞ！\n腕立て、腹筋、屈み跳躍各３０回を３セット:
That's a good answer! Let's get started!
Push-ups, sit-ups and crouching jumps, three sets of thirty each! Get at me immediately!!
すぐに指示通りにトレーニングを始める４人。: The four of them immediately began training as instructed.
（……まあ、素直に聞いてくれるのはいいことだが）: (...Well, it's good that he's willing to listen to me.)
シリウスシュガーにした時とは違って、素直に聞いてくれる。\n反発することもなく真:
She listened obediently, unlike when I'd turned her into Sirius Sugar.
She's taking this seriously without any backlash.
（くっ……なんだこの物足りなさは……！\nなんというかシリウスシュガーのような歯:
(Ugh... What is this lack of food...!?)
How should I put it? I don't feel the same crunch as Sirius Sugar...)
はぁ、はぁ……そ、それで次は何をしたらいいのかしら？: *pant pant*... S-So, what should I do next?
どんな厳しいメニューだってドンと来いだよ！\nシリウスシュガーのみんなから聞いて:
No matter how strict the menu is, it's always there!
I heard about it from everyone in Sirius Sugaru, and I'm mentally prepared!
どうやら心の覚悟は十分だったようだな！\nおりこうさんな貴様らには追加訓練だ！:
Looks like you were mentally prepared for this!
It's extra training for you orikosans!
（……落ち着け。素直過ぎて物足りなく感じるのは良くないぞ。\n俺の目的はこいつら:
(...Calm down. It's not good to be too honest and feel unsatisfied.
My goal is to let these guys win, after all.)
――よし、準備運動はここまでだ！\nまずは綱引き！ ロープを用意しろっ、駆け足！:
—Okay, that's it for warm-up exercises!
First, the tug-of-war! Get the rope ready, run!!
持ってきた縄を２人ずつのチームに分けて綱引きをさせる。\n現状では力持ちというラ:
We split the ropes we brought into teams of two and had them do a tug-of-war.
As things stood, Laura's side, said to be powerful, had the upper hand.
綱引きはひとりの力で勝負が決まるわけじゃない！\n呼吸を合わせろ！ そうすれば拮:
A tug-of-war isn't decided by one person's own strength!
Match your breathing! If you do that, we should be able to compete!
組み合わせを変えて何度も挑戦することで最終的に、\nどの組み合わせでも拮抗する程:
By changing the combination and trying again and again, in the end...
They had become so in sync that they could compete with each other in any combination.
次はリレーの練習だ。リレーは受け渡しの呼吸合わせが重要だ。\n走る速さも重要だが:
Next, we'll be practicing for the relay race. It's important to keep in sync with the relay.
Running speed is important, but you can also see strategy in this game!
バトンを受け渡すタイミングを完璧に身体に叩き込め！\n受け渡そうと思うな、気がつ:
Hit your body with perfect timing to hand the baton over!
Don't think about handing it over. Before you know it, it's like you're crossing over to the other person!
あっさりとリレーも組み合わせを変えても成功するように。\nやはり、プレ・クラス－:
So that even if you change the relays quickly, you'll succeed.
As I thought, Pre-Class-A's coordination has improved significantly.
次は玉入れだ。この競技は個人技の競技に見えるが、\nチームでお互いの弱みをカバー:
Next is the ball case. This competition looks like an individual technique competition, but...
There are also factors that cover each other's weaknesses as a team.
集中力を持って的を狙え！ 外すとしても、\nお互いの立ち位置を意識して投げればカ:
Take concentration and aim for the target! Even if you miss,
If you throw it consciously where you stand, you can cover it!
最初だからか、玉入れはそこまで結果は出なかった。\nだが、この様子であればあっと:
Maybe it was because it was the first time, but Tamaire didn't get that much results.
But at this rate, she would master it in no time at all.
よし、そこまで！ 全員集合しろ！: All right, that's it! Gather up!
……さて、貴様らに伝える事がある。\nこれ以上は教えることがないということだ！:
...Now then, I have something to tell you.
I have nothing more to teach you!
返事は『イエッサー』だけっていうのは指示に従えってことで\n『イエッサー』だけで:
If the only reply is yessir, that means you have to follow the instructions.
I'm not asking you to talk just because you're a yesser.
えっ。じゃあ普通に喋っても大丈夫なの？: Huh? So it's okay to talk normally?
特訓中に質問があったらどうするつもりだったのよ……: What were you planning to do if you had any questions during training...?
私もイエッサーしか言えないと思ってたよー。: I thought only Yessir could say it, too.
それで、ジュリーは何が言いたかったんだ？: So, what was Julie trying to say?
もう教えることはないってどういうこと！？\nまだ初日なのに……もしかして、あたし:
What do you mean there's nothing left to teach me?!
It's only the first day... Maybe we were too perfect!?
調子に乗るんじゃない。まあ、俺も大雑把に言いすぎた。\n無理にスパルタな訓練をし:
Don't get carried away. Well, I've said too much.
That means they don't have to force themselves to do spartan training. They have the strength.
多分、前の事件で鍛えられたのが良かったんだろうな。\nだから、ここからは普通のコ:
It was probably for the best that she'd been trained during the last incident.
That's why I'm going to coach you normally from here on out.
じゃあ、まだ私たちと一緒にいてくれるの？: So you're still going to be with us?
なーんだ。焦って損したわ。: What's this? What a waste of time.
よーし！ それじゃあ優勝に向けて明日からもがんばるわよ！: All right! Let's do our best tomorrow to win!
（燻っている人間は、何かしらの切っ掛けで成長するが……\n前の事件はジュリーたち:
(People who are smoldering will grow up with some kind of trigger, but...)
Looks like the last incident was a turning point for Julie and the others to grow.)
（このまま順調にいけば体育祭で優勝も現実的な話になるな。\nなら、細かい部分でし:
(If things keep going smoothly, winning the sports festival will be a realistic story.
In that case, I guess I'll just have to support her in the details.)
それから数日が経過した。\n当初、想定していた以上に特訓は成果が出ている。:
Several days had passed since then.
In the beginning, special training has produced more results than I had initially anticipated.
うぐぐ……うあー！ だめ、我慢できない……ううう！\nはぁ……ごめんね、みんなぁ:
Ugh... Uwah! No, I can't hold back... Uuu!
Hah... I'm sorry, everyone... Ugh...
気にしないで。どうしても難しい事ってあるもの。\nノエルちゃんは、勝手に体が動い:
Don't worry about it. There's always something difficult.
Noel's body moves on its own, right?
うん……邪魔なものがあるなぁって思ったら、\n体が勝手に動いて壊しちゃう……:
Yeah... Just when I thought there was something in the way...
My body moves on its own, destroying it...
まさか、こんな落とし穴があったとはな……: I didn't think there'd be a pitfall like this...
問題が起きたのは、障害物競走のトレーニング中。\nノエルが障害物を強引に倒して無:
The problem arose during the obstacle course training.
Noel will forcefully defeat the obstacles and force her way through.
いくつかの障害を乗り越えて最後は網の下を這って通り抜ける。\nそんなコースが予定:
After overcoming a few obstacles, they eventually crawled under the net and passed through.
That's the plan, but...
そうね……ハードルや跳び箱、\nコーンの間を通り抜けるスラローム走でも障害を薙ぎ:
That's right... hurdles, jumpboxes,
Even in a slalom run through the corn, it mowed down obstacles.
でもノエルが一番速くゴールしたわよ？: But Noel reached the finish line the fastest.
薙ぎ倒して早くゴールしても障害物競走の意味がないでしょ。\n……しかし、これは困:
There's no point in mowing them down and finishing the race quickly.
...Still, this is a problem.
ううん……障害物を倒すとペナルティでタイムが加算されるし……\nあんまり倒した数:
No... Defeating obstacles adds a penalty to your time...
If you defeat too many of them, you'll be disqualified.
まあ、ノエルはほとんど無意識に全部蹴っ飛ばしたりしたから、\n間違いなく失格判定:
Well, Noel had almost unconsciously kicked them all, so...
I'm sure I'll be disqualified.
うう……ごめんね……でも、気づいたら邪魔だなぁって思って、\n勝手に体が動いちゃ:
Ugh... I'm sorry... But before I knew it, I thought I'd be in the way
My body moves on its own.
でも、ノエルちゃんに取っても大変だと思うわ。\n普段から壊したい気持ちを我慢して:
But I don't think it'll be easy for Noel.
She's probably holding back the urge to break it...
まあ、そういう意味じゃ本気で壊さなくて助かるよ。\n場合によっちゃハードルを折っ:
Well, in that sense, I'm glad you didn't seriously break it.
Depending on the situation, it might break the bar.
（……もしも破損してたら俺が弁償することになるんだろうか？\nそういう意味でもノ:
(...If it's damaged, will I have to pay for it?)
In that sense, I want Noel to do her best.)
こういう時は気にしすぎちゃダメよ！\n自然な感じでやれば多分大丈夫だから！:
Don't worry too much at times like this!
If you do it naturally, it'll probably be fine!
それじゃあ、もう一回やってみましょ？\n練習してたらきっと良くなるはずだわ。:
Well then, let's try it again, shall we?
I'm sure you'll get better if you practice.
しかし、何度やってみても結果は同じだった。: However, no matter how many times I tried, the result was always the same.
日頃はなんとか抑え込んでいる衝動は競技に集中すると、\nどうしてもコントロールで:
The urge to somehow suppress it on a daily basis focused on the competition, and...
It seems I'll lose control no matter what.
ごめん。やっぱり私、だめっぽい……: Sorry. I guess I'm hopeless after all...
（……我慢しようとしてるんだが気が緩んだら、\nつい蹴ったりしてしまうみたいだな:
(...I'm trying to hold back, but if I let my guard down,
Looks like I ended up kicking her...)
ここで一旦休憩にしよう。\nこれ以上続けるのはノエルの負担が大きい。:
Let's take a break here.
Continuing any further would put a heavy burden on Noel.
ねえ……私は障害物競争に不参加ってのはダメかな……？: Hey... Am I not allowed to participate in the obstacle course?
ううん……ノエルが抜けるとあたしとラウラで全部走るのよね……: No... When Noel leaves, Laura and I run all over the place...
ごめんなさい。私が足のせいで走る競技に参加できないから……\n二人だけで競技に勝:
I'm sorry. I can't participate in the race because of my legs...
It wouldn't be realistic if the two of us could win the competition alone. So, please.
そうだな……他の生徒が四人チームで走る所を、\n三人で走ってるだけでも相当なハン:
That's right... I saw the other students running in a four-person team
Just the three of us running together is quite a handicap, after all.
体力的な問題もあるわ……他の走らない競技なら、私が頑張る。\nだから、ノエル……:
There's also the issue of physical strength... If it's another non-running competition, I'll do my best.
That's why, Noel... I want you to do your best in this competition.
（……心香も心苦しそうだな。\n自分の怪我のせいで無理を言ってるから仕方ないが）:
(...Kokoroka seems to be in pain too.
It can't be helped, though, since she's asking for the impossible because of her own injury.)
それにノエルは、私達の中でも身体能力はずば抜けて高い……\nノエル無しで優勝する:
And Noel's physically stronger than any of us...
It's impossible to win without Noel.
……だから、お願い。\n私に出来る事なら、なんでってするから。:
...So, please.
I'll do whatever I can to help.
うう……分かった……何とか頑張ってみる……: Ugh... All right... I'll do my best...
ノエルも自分の役割は分かっている。\nそれでも弱音が出てきてしまう程に大変なのだ:
Noel knows what her role is.
Even so, it must have been so hard that a weak voice came out.
ふーむ……他に良い方法がないか考えてみるか。: Hmm... Let's see if there's any other way.
うーん……そういわれても難しいわね……: Hmm... Even if you say that, it's hard...
メイズ探索に置き換えて考えてみよう。ノエルはＭＧに乗ったとき、\nもし狭くて障害:
Let's think about replacing it with a search for the Maze. When Noel got on the MG...
What if we're in a cramped, obstacle-ridden place?
え？ その時は当然全部壊して進んじゃうよ？: Huh? If that happens, of course we'll destroy them all and move on.
だって、メイズでそういう場所があったとして、\n視界が開けてないし危険だから壊し:
I mean, let's say there was a place like that in Mayse
It's dangerous and it's not open, so it'll be easier to destroy it.
納得してどうするのよ。: What are you going to do if I agree?
あはは……今はメイズ探索に例えるのはダメだったかも。\n正解は色々とあるものね。:
Ahaha... Maybe I shouldn't have compared it to searching for Mayse right now.
There are a lot of correct answers.
そうね……うーん、でもどうするのがいいのかしら？\nノエルが暴れずに障害物を超え:
Yeah... Hmm, but what should we do?
A way for Noel to surpass obstacles without flailing...
ふうむ……\n部屋の中に置かれているものは壊したりしないんだよな？:
Hmm...
You won't destroy anything in the room, will you?
流石にそんなことはしないよ！？ ……ある程度は。: Of course I wouldn't do that! ...To a certain extent.
それでもある程度なのね。\nうーん、じゃあやっぱり解決方法にならない気がするわ。:
Even so, it's only to a certain extent.
Hmm, then I don't think there's a way to solve it.
いわゆる癖みたいなものよね……\nいきなり癖をやめろって言われても辞めれたら苦労:
It's like a habit...
I won't have any trouble if you suddenly tell me to quit my habit.
そういって練習を繰り返すが、結局その日はうまくいかないまま、\n練習を終えること:
She repeated her practice as she said that, but in the end, it didn't go well that day.
We ended our practice session.
